projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: A portfolio website showcasing my skills and projects.
projects.longDescription: This is my personal portfolio, built with React and Framer Motion, using Vite for fast development and optimized performance. The site serves as a presentation of my abilities and experience in web development.

projects.name: PyBet
projects.description: A group project - AI-powered betting assistant.
projects.longDescription: PyBet is a group project utilizing Vue.js for the frontend and Django for the backend. It employs machine learning to identify profitable odds on Polish bookmaker websites. I was responsible for team-leading the backend development and writing unit tests. The project will be deployed soon.

projects.name: GetProxy
projects.description: A simple Java-based proxy within an iframe.
projects.longDescription: GetProxy is a simple Java-based proxy that runs inside an iframe. It was created to overcome iframe navigation limitations. Built with Spring Boot (using an embedded Tomcat server) and a minimalistic React frontend. Currently, the core functionality is unavailable due to the lack of a deployed backend.

projects.name: Harmonic Motion Simulator
projects.description: A simple physics simulation with Node.js backend.
projects.longDescription: This project is a simple front-end simulation of harmonic motion, connected to a Node.js backend. The backend allows user account creation, login, and simulation setting storage. It also features cookies to store login states. Currently, the backend is disabled.

projects.name: Mountain Trails Database
projects.longDescription: This project is an MVC application built with Spring Boot. While the UI is basic, the project helped me understand the MVC model and database connectivity in Spring. It uses Java, Spring Boot (Spring Web, Spring Data JDBC), Thymeleaf, REST API, and PostgreSQL. Currently, the application is offline.

projects.name: OCR Raider
projects.description: A basic OCR application with a custom algorithm.
projects.longDescription: OCR Raider is a simple full-stack project created as a team effort. It features a custom-built text recognition algorithm written in Python. The backend is currently offline.
